title: ‘GM Street’ — Big Moves, Big Splashes, Big Injuries (Ep. 134)
description:
The Ringer’s Mike Lombardi and Tate Frazier discuss the implications of the weekend’s big moves in football: what Andrew Luck’s shoulder injury means for the Colts (1:10), the Patriots’ motivations behind trading Jacoby Brissett for Phillip Dorsett (4:15), and the Seahawks’ rising Super Bowl chances after acquiring Sheldon Richardson (16:25).

      
Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices
